mdRecord.dcterms:title: "Lord Avebury and Grazing Animals" and etc; 08 of 08
mdRecord.dcterms:description: 3. Doepner/Faulds--NotesItems 33-74, cloth sleeve"The Truth About Darwinism"; Reoccurring section of a periodical for BENA (British Empire Naturalist Association), where an ongoing discussion of multiple aspects of Darwinism is addressed by experts who write-in, along with editor comments. Select pages pulled for Faulds's notes. Included articles in this batch: "Lord Avebury and Grazing Animals" by James L. Carrick, "The Direct Action of Circumstances" by Harold Jeffreys, "The Goal in View" by H. R. Meredith, "The Solar Logos: The Force of Life" a poem by Rochers de Naye, "How the Truth (About Darwinism) Wins" by 'an Enthusiastic Reader', "Hawk Moths and Their Caterpillars" by E. K. R., "'Improvement' and 'Beauty' in Nature" which, under the same title, has multiple commentaries by E. C. Freeman and H. Richardson, "Water Lilies and Animals" by G. W. Elton, and "Blue-eyed Cats: a Correction" by Wm. Harvey.; E. Kay Robinson (E. K. R.), ed., London, p. 483-490, Country-Side; 8 pages; DF n.a.
